com.omerozer.knit.schedulers.heavy

Class HeavyThread

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.Context
      • android.content.ContextWrapper
        • android.app.Service
          • android.app.IntentService
            • com.omerozer.knit.schedulers.heavy.HeavyThread
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HThread1, HThread2, HThread3, HThread4

    public abstract class HeavyThread
extends android.app.IntentService
    Base class for all threads in HeavyTaskScheduler pool.

    • Method Detail

      • handleTask

        public static void handleTask(java.lang.String threadId,
                              TaskPackage taskPackage,
                              android.content.Context context,
                              java.lang.Class<? extends HeavyThread> taskThread)
        This methods starts HeavyThreads.
        Parameters:
        threadId - Unique identifier for the HeavyThread
        taskPackage - Package that contains the task to be handled.
        context - Android Context to help start the HeavyThreads
        taskThread - The exact thread type to be used for the thread pool.(HThread1, HThread2... etc)

      • getNextTask

        private static TaskPackage getNextTask(java.lang.String threadId)
        Polls the next task from the queue for the given thread id.
        Parameters:
        threadId - Given thread id .
        Returns:
        Next task wrapper around TaskPackage

      • getTaskQueueForThread

        private static java.util.Queue<TaskPackage> getTaskQueueForThread(java.lang.String threadId)
        Returns the task queue for the given thread id.
        Parameters:
        threadId - Given thread id .
        Returns:
        Task queue for the given thread id.

      • getPriority

        public static int getPriority(java.lang.String threadId)
        Returns the priority of the active HeavyThread with the given id. Priority is the number of current active tasks. A priority of 0 means, the thread is the most available to receive an incoming task.
        Parameters:
        threadId -
        Returns:
